</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.O.1
<SEQUENCE>4
<FILENAME>k12522exv10wow1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>ANNUAL INCENTIVE COMPENSATION PLAN METRICS
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10wow1</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left">
<A name="171"></A>
</DIV>


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10-O-1</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>Annual Incentive Compensation Plan Metrics for 2007</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">On
February&nbsp;27, 2007, the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors of the Company approved
the specific performance goals and business criteria to be used for purposes of determining any
future cash awards for 2007 for participants, including executive officers, under the Company&#146;s
shareholder-approved Annual Incentive Compensation Plan (filed as Exhibit&nbsp;10-T to the Company&#146;s
Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 1999). For most participants, the
performance criteria and weightings to be used for 2007 under the plan include attaining specified
levels of:
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>total company pre-tax profits (40%),</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>relevant business unit pre-tax profits (15%),</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>total Automotive operating-related cash flow (20%),</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>relevant business unit cost reductions (8.33%),</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>relevant business unit market shares (8.33%), and</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>relevant business unit quality metrics (8.33%).</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">For some participants, including certain executive officers, whose job responsibilities encompass
multiple business units, the performance criteria to be used for 2007 under the plan include
attaining specified levels of:
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>total company pre-tax profits (55%),</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>total Automotive operating-related cash flow (20%),</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>total company cost reductions (8.33%),</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>total company market shares (8.33%), and</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>total company quality metrics (8.33%).</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Based on business performance results for 2007 against the targeted levels established for each
criterion, the Compensation Committee will determine the percentage of the target award that is
earned, which could range between 0% and 200% depending on actual performance achieved relative to
the target levels. In addition, individual awards may be increased (within limits set by the
Compensation Committee) or decreased from a formula amount, based on leadership level or salary
grade level, to reward a person&#146;s performance.
</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio --><!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>


</BODY>
</HTML>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In March&nbsp;2006, the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors awarded you the opportunity to
earn restricted stock equivalents (RSEs). The size of this award opportunity was calculated by
converting one-half of the value of the amount of stock options that you otherwise would have
received to an equivalent value of RSEs. The Compensation Committee designated the following as
the 2006 performance metrics for this award:
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">

you are being awarded &#091; &#093; RSEs.

which time dividend equivalents will be paid in cash, if dividends are paid on Ford Common Stock.
As soon as practicable after the restriction lapses, shares of Ford Common Stock will be issued to
you, less any shares withheld to cover any tax liability on the value of the grant.

conditions provided at grant.
</DIV>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.P.14
<SEQUENCE>6
<FILENAME>k12522exv10wpw14.htm
<DESCRIPTION>DESCRIPTION OF PERFORMANCE-BASED RESTRICTED STOCKS UNITS
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10wpw14</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">



<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10-P-14</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Performance-Based Restricted Stock Units (RSUs) Description<BR>
for &#091;2007&#093; Performance Period<BR>
Executive Compensation &#038; Benefits<BR>
(Formerly referred to as Performance Stock Rights (PSRs))</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 24pt">Issued: March <U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U>, &#091;2007&#093;

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>What are Restricted Stock Units (RSUs)?</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">RSUs are phantom shares of Ford common stock that are paid out in actual shares following a
specified performance and/or restriction period. Performance-based RSUs give you the opportunity
to earn a number of RSUs (final award) over a specified performance period, based on the
achievement of certain performance objectives. Any RSUs awarded to you convert to bonafide shares
of Ford Common Stock after a specified, time-based restriction period.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Because RSUs are not &#147;real&#148; shares until the restriction period ends, you will not be eligible to
vote the shares, nor are the shares registered in your name.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">RSUs are different from a stock option grant that gives you the right to purchase shares of Ford
stock at a specified price during a certain time period.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Who is eligible to receive Performance-Based RSUs and when are they awarded?</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">LL1 employees are eligible to be considered for performance-based RSU opportunity grants in March
of each year. The Company&#146;s grant to an employee of a performance-based RSU is not an element of
the employee&#146;s compensation. Any final award does not entitle an employee to any further grants in
the future and the Company does not guarantee that benefits under the 1998 Long-Term Incentive Plan
will have a particular value or be granted to the employee in the future.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>How do performance-based RSUs work?</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Performance-based RSUs have a one-year performance period after which a final award, if any, is
determined based on the Company&#146;s performance on specific metrics applicable to the grant.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">At the beginning of each performance period, management recommends a performance-based RSU
opportunity grant based on your expected future contributions to Ford&#146;s success. The one-year
performance period begins in January of the year of the grant and ends in December of the year of
the grant. For example, the performance period for the March &#091;2007&#093; grant is from January &#091;2007&#093;
through December &#091;2007&#093;.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Each metric is weighted toward the total final award determination. Metrics for the
performance-based RSUs covering the January &#091;2007&#093; &#151; December &#091;2007&#093; performance period include
pre-tax profits (both total and business unit), total Automotive operating-related cash flow, business
unit cost performance, market share, and quality. The performance goals and weightings for each
metric are the same as those used under the Annual Incentive Compensation Plan for the applicable
performance period.
</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>How are the final awards calculated?</B>
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Following the end of the one-year period, performance results are evaluated against the initial
objectives, and it is determined whether a final award will be made. Payouts can range from 0% to
100% of the initial target amount, depending on Company performance on the metrics. For &#091;2007&#093;,
the goals for pre-tax profit and Automotive operating-related cash flow have a minimum threshold that must be
met in order to receive credit for that metric. For each of these metrics, the minimum threshold
is &#091;80%&#093; of the related objective.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Any final award is issued in the form of RSUs having a &#091;one/two/three-year&#093; restriction period and
will be determined by the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors. An account showing the
RSU final award will be set up in your name. At the end of the restriction period, the RSUs are
converted to actual shares of Ford common stock, less shares withheld to cover any tax liability on
the value of the award. The shares carry all associated rights including voting rights and the
right to any dividend payments.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Performance-based RSUs are subject to the terms and conditions described herein and in the
Company&#146;s 1998 Long-Term Incentive Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Will I receive dividends or equivalents on my performance-based RSU grant?</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Dividend equivalents will not be paid on your performance-based RSU grant either during the
performance period or during the restriction period. Dividends will begin after any RSU final
award converts to actual shares of Ford common stock, if the Company is paying dividends on common
stock.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>What happens to my grant if I leave the Company during the one-year performance period or before
the &#091;one/three-year&#093; restriction is over?</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">If you leave the Company for reasons of voluntary quit, discharge, or release in the best interest
of the Company, your grant will be cancelled and you will forfeit the grant opportunity.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">If your employment with the Company terminates before the one-year performance period is over for
any reason other than voluntary quit, discharge, or release in the best interest of the Company,
and your termination date is at least six months after the grant of your RSU opportunity, you will
be eligible to be considered for a pro-rated award, based on the number of full months worked
during the performance period. Final awards are determined at the discretion of the Compensation
Committee of the Board of Directors.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Are there any other conditions related to the RSU awards?</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">There are several other conditions that you should be aware of:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">1)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>You must refrain from engaging in any activity that is directly or indirectly in competition
with any activity of the Company or any subsidiary thereof. In the event of non-fulfillment
of this condition, your rights in the RSU grant, including the right to have any final award
converted to real shares of Ford stock at the end of the applicable restriction period, will
be forfeited and cancelled.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">2)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Your rights in the RSUs, including the right to have any final award converted to real shares
of Ford Stock at the end of the applicable restriction period, will be forfeited and cancelled
if it is determined that you have acted in a manner inimical to the best interests of the
Company.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">



</TABLE>
</DIV>



<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">3)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Your RSUs are subject to the terms and conditions described herein and in the Company&#146;s 1998
Long-Term Incentive Plan.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">*&nbsp;The FMV is the average of the high and low price of Ford Common Stock trading on the New York
Stock Exchange on the applicable date.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

</BODY>
</HTML>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.P.15
<SEQUENCE>7
<FILENAME>k12522exv10wpw15.htm
<DESCRIPTION>FORM OF FINAL AWARD NOTIFICATION
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10wpw15</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left">
<A name="169"></A>
</DIV>


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10-P-15</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><IMG src="k12522k1252200.gif" alt="(FORD LOGO)">
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 70%">Joe W. Laymon<BR>
Group Vice President<BR>
Corporate Human Resources<BR>
and Labor Affairs

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 70%">March <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U>, 2007

</DIV>
<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="7%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="92%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Head -->
<!-- Begin Table Body -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">To:
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">LL2 and Above Employees</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">Subject:
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Final Award for the 2004-2006 Performance Stock Right Grant</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The 2004-2006 performance period for the 2004 Performance Stock Right grants (sometimes
referred to as LTI grants) ended on December&nbsp;31, 2006. The performance metrics for the 2004 grant
were Ford Motor Company&#146;s total shareholder return (stock appreciation plus dividends) relative to
the S&#038;P 500, Total Cost Performance, Global Market Share, High Time-in-Service Improvement and
Launch Metrics in the Period. Based on the performance-to-metrics, the Compensation Committee has
approved a final award of 39% of the initial grant.
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In recognition of the Company&#146;s accomplishments, as well as your personal contributions to our
collective efforts, you will receive a final award in Ford common stock (net after taxes) related
to your 2006 Performance Stock Right grant. Your final award, net of shares withheld to cover any
tax liability, was deposited into a book-entry account with Computershare Trust Company, N.A.
during March. Your award is made under the 1998 Long-Term Incentive Plan and is subject to its
provisions.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Thank you for your contribution to the achievement of our objectives during the 2004-2006
performance period.
</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio --><!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

</BODY>
</HTML>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.P.16
<SEQUENCE>8
<FILENAME>k12522exv10wpw16.htm
<DESCRIPTION>DESCRIPTION OF TIME-BASED RESTRICTED STOCK UNITS
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10wpw16</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">
<!-- link2 "Exhibit&nbsp;10-P-16" -->
<DIV align="left">
<A name="176"></A>
</DIV>

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10-P-16</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 24pt"><B>Time-Based Restricted Stock Units (RSUs) Description<BR>
For &#091;2007&#093; Annual Stock-Based Grants</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">Issued: March <U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U>, &#091;2007&#093;

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>What are Restricted Stock Units (RSUs)?</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">RSUs are phantom shares of Ford common stock that are paid out in actual shares following a
specified performance and/or restriction period. Time-based RSUs awarded to you convert to
bonafide shares of Ford Common Stock after a specified restriction period.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Because RSUs are not &#147;real&#148; shares until the restriction period ends, you will not be eligible to
vote the shares, nor are the shares registered in your name.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">RSUs are different from a stock option grant that gives you the right to purchase shares of Ford
stock at a specified price during a certain time period.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Who is eligible to receive Time-Based RSUs and when are they awarded?</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">LL5&#043; employees are eligible to be considered for a time-based RSU grant in March of each year. The
Company&#146;s grant to an employee of a time-based RSU is not an element of the employee&#146;s
compensation. Any grant to an employee does not entitle an employee to any further grants in the
future and the Company does not guarantee that benefits under the 1998 Long-Term Incentive Plan
will have a particular value or be granted to the employee in the future.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>How do time-based RSUs work? What happens when the restriction period lifts?</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Time-based RSUs vest over a specified restriction period. &#091;Grants awarded in &#091;2007&#093; vest over a
three year period. 33% of your grant will vest after one year; 33% after two years; and 34% after
three years.&#093;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">During the annual compensation planning process, management recommends a stock-based award having a
dollar value based on your Leadership Level and your expected future contributions to Ford&#146;s
success. The number of RSUs granted to you is based on the Fair Market Value<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">*</SUP> (FMV)&nbsp;of
Ford Common Stock on the grant date. An account showing your RSU grant will be set up in your
name at &#091;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#093;.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">At the end of the specified restriction period, the RSUs are converted to actual shares of Ford
common stock, less shares withheld to cover any tax liability on the value of the award. The
shares carry all associated rights including voting rights and the right to any dividend payments.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Will I receive dividends on my RSUs during the restriction period?</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Dividend equivalents will not be paid on your RSU grant during the restriction period.
Dividends will begin after the RSU grant converts to actual shares of Ford common stock, if the
Company is paying dividends on common stock.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>What about taxes?</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">RSUs are generally not recognized as taxable income at the time the RSU grant is made. As
soon as practicable after the restriction period ends, shares of Ford common stock will be issued
to you for this grant &#091;less shares withheld to cover any tax liability on the value of the grant&#093;.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>What happens to my grant if I leave the Company before the &#091;one/two/three&#093; year restriction is
over?</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">If you leave the Company for any reason other than death, disability or approved retirement before
the restriction period ends, or if your employment terminates for any reason prior to six months
following the grant date, your grant will automatically be forfeited.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Are there any other conditions related to the RSU awards?</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">There are several other conditions that you should be aware of:
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">



<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">1)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>You must refrain from engaging in any activity that is directly or indirectly in competition
with any activity of the Company or any subsidiary thereof. In the event of non-fulfillment
of this condition, your rights in the RSU grant, including the right to have the grant
converted to real shares of Ford stock at the end of the applicable restriction period, will
be forfeited and cancelled.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">2)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Your rights in the RSUs, including the right to have the grant converted to real shares of
Ford Stock at the end of the applicable restriction period, will be forfeited and cancelled if
it is determined that you have acted in a manner inimical to the best interests of the
Company.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">3)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Your RSUs are subject to the terms and conditions described herein and in the Company&#146;s 1998
Long-Term Incentive Plan.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">*&nbsp;The FMV is the average of the high and low price of Ford Common Stock trading on the New York
Stock Exchange on the applicable date.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

</BODY>
</HTML>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.R
<SEQUENCE>9
<FILENAME>k12522exv10wr.htm
<DESCRIPTION>AMENDED & RESTATED AGREEMENT
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10wr</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left">
<A name="168"></A>
</DIV>


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10-R</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U><B>AMENDED AND RESTATED AGREEMENT</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Amended and Restated Agreement (the &#147;Agreement&#148;) dated as of December&nbsp;12, 2006 is made
and entered into between Ford Motor Company, a Delaware corporation (&#147;Ford&#148;), and Ford Motor Credit
Company, a Delaware corporation (&#147;Ford Credit&#148;).
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>RECITALS</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A.&nbsp;Ford Credit supports the sale of Ford&#146;s products by providing, among other things,
wholesale, retail and lease financing for the purchase and lease of those products.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B.&nbsp;Ford Credit is highly dependent on the public debt markets to raise funds for its
business.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;C.&nbsp;Ford Credit&#146;s ability to raise funds in the public debt markets is highly dependent on its
credit ratings, which, in turn, are dependent on the level of Ford Credit&#146;s equity capital, the
quality of its assets and its liquidity.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D.&nbsp;It is important to the success of Ford that Ford Credit remains a viable finance company
that can fund itself in the public debt markets and continue supporting the sale of Ford&#146;s
products.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E.&nbsp;Towards maintaining the viability of Ford Credit, the parties entered into an agreement
dated October&nbsp;18, 2001 (the &#147;October&nbsp;18, 2001 Agreement&#148;) that provides for certain agreements
regarding transactions between them and the creditworthiness of Ford Credit.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;F.&nbsp;The parties desire to amend the October&nbsp;18, 2001 Agreement to, among other things, provide
for the right to offset their obligations to each other.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW, THEREFORE, for good and valuable consideration and the mutual agreements herein provided,
the parties agree as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;The parties agree that all Affiliate Receivables (as defined below) shall be on
arm&#146;s-length terms. For purposes hereof, &#147;Affiliate Receivables&#148; means any advance, loan, extension
of credit, or other financing to Ford or any affiliate of Ford whose assets and liabilities are
classified on Ford&#146;s consolidated balance sheet as Automotive (&#147;Automotive Affiliate&#148;). Ford Credit
shall enforce, and cause any affiliate of Ford Credit whose assets and liabilities are consolidated
with Ford Credit&#146;s on Ford Credit&#146;s consolidated balance sheet (&#147;Credit Affiliate&#148;) to enforce, all
Affiliate Receivables in a commercially reasonable manner, and Ford shall pay, shall cause its
Automotive Affiliates to pay and shall guarantee its Automotive Affiliates&#146; payment of, Affiliate
Receivables in accordance with their terms.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;Ford Credit shall not, nor shall it permit any Credit Affiliate to, guarantee any
indebtedness of (other than Permitted Guarantees), or purchase any equity securities issued by, or
make any other investment in, Ford (parent company only) or any Automotive Affiliate. In addition,
Ford Credit shall not, nor shall it permit any Credit Affiliate to, purchase or finance any
real property (other than Permitted Mortgages) or manufacturing equipment (including tooling)
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio --><!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>


<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">from or of Ford or any Automotive Affiliate that is classified as an Automotive asset on
Ford&#146;s consolidated balance sheet. Ford shall not, nor shall it permit any Automotive Affiliate to
request or require Ford Credit or any Credit Affiliate to do any of the transactions prohibited by
this paragraph 2. For purposes hereof, &#147;Permitted Guarantees&#148; shall mean guarantees by Ford Credit
or Credit Affiliates of indebtedness of Ford or Automotive Affiliates which at any time does not
exceed $500&nbsp;million in the aggregate, and &#147;Permitted Mortgages&#148; shall mean financing by Ford Credit
or Credit Affiliates of real property of Ford or Automotive Affiliates which at any time does not
exceed $500&nbsp;million in the aggregate.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;Ford and Ford Credit agree that Ford Credit&#146;s total stockholder&#146;s equity as stated on or
reflected in its consolidated financial statements shall, at the end of any calendar quarter during
which this Agreement is in effect, be maintained at a commercially reasonable level appropriate to
support the amount, quality and mix (i.e., retail finance receivables, wholesale finance
receivables and lease receivables) of Ford Credit&#146;s assets as stated on or reflected in its
consolidated financial statements for the same calendar quarter, taking into account general
business conditions affecting Ford Credit.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;Ford Credit shall, and shall cause each Credit Affiliate to, conduct its business,
including its finance and lease business, in a prudent and commercially reasonable manner,
including maintaining and adhering to credit risk underwriting standards for finance and lease
receivables and residual assumptions for lease receivables it acquires or originates that are
consistent with industry standards. Ford shall not, nor shall it permit any Automotive Affiliate
to, require Ford Credit or any Credit Affiliate to accept credit or residual risk beyond what it
would be willing to accept acting in a prudent and commercially reasonable manner. For avoidance of
doubt, acquisition or origination of finance or lease receivables having terms that are not
market-based shall be considered to be prudent and commercially reasonable if subsidies (in the
form of interest rate subvention payments, guarantees, residual risk sharing arrangements or
otherwise) are provided by Ford or an Automotive Affiliate in an amount sufficient to assure that
Ford Credit or a Credit Affiliate, as the case may be, will receive the economic benefits of such
receivables as if they had been acquired or originated on market-based terms. Notwithstanding the
foregoing, in recognition of the fact that Ford uses Ford Credit as the exclusive provider of
financial services for special retail and lease programs to support the sale of products
manufactured by Ford and other Automotive Affiliates, it is understood that it would be
commercially reasonable and prudent for Ford Credit to accept, to a limited extent, higher levels
of credit risk than it might otherwise accept in order to continue as the exclusive provider of
financial services to Ford and the other Automotive Affiliates with respect to such programs. For
any given program, Ford Credit may waive its right to be the exclusive provider of financial
services to Ford and the other Automotive Affiliates.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.&nbsp;Ford and Ford Credit agree that (a)&nbsp;Ford Credit shall at all times maintain its books,
records, financial statements and bank accounts separate from those of Ford and any Automotive
Affiliate; (b)&nbsp;Ford Credit shall maintain its assets in such a manner that it will not be costly or
difficult to segregate, ascertain or identify its assets from those of Ford and any Automotive
Affiliate; (c)&nbsp;the funds and other assets of Ford Credit shall not be commingled with those of Ford
or any Automotive Affiliate; (d)&nbsp;Ford Credit shall at all times hold itself out as a legal entity
separate and distinct from Ford and any Automotive Affiliate; (e)&nbsp;except with respect to the
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->2<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">performance of their respective obligations under that certain Amended and Restated Profit
Maintenance Agreement dated as of January&nbsp;1, 2002 between Ford and Ford Credit (as it may be
amended from time to time), each will act in a manner and conduct its business such that creditors
of Ford, acting reasonably, will rely primarily on the creditworthiness of, and look solely to the
assets of Ford, for repayment of indebtedness and creditors of Ford Credit, acting reasonably, will
rely primarily on the creditworthiness of, and look solely to the assets of Ford Credit, for
repayment of indebtedness; and (f)&nbsp;they otherwise will take such reasonable and customary action so
that Ford Credit will not be consolidated with Ford or any Automotive Affiliate in any case or
other proceeding seeking liquidation, reorganization or other relief with respect to Ford or any
Automotive Affiliate or its debts under any bankruptcy, insolvency or other similar law.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.&nbsp;The sum of (i)&nbsp;the aggregate amount of unused committed credit facilities, (ii)&nbsp;the
unutilized portion of the aggregate dollar amount of receivables that bank-sponsored, commercial
paper issuers (conduits)&nbsp;are contractually committed to purchase from Ford Credit and (iii)&nbsp;cash,
cash equivalents and marketable securities (and any other sources of liquidity that may be agreed
upon from time to time) of Ford Credit and its consolidated subsidiaries shall at all times be at
least equal to 100% of the outstanding commercial paper of Ford Credit and its consolidated
subsidiaries.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.&nbsp;In the event that Ford or any of its subsidiaries engages in a corporate transaction that
causes the Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation (&#147;PBGC&#148;) to threaten to terminate the pension plans
sponsored by Ford or any of its subsidiaries, Ford shall, or shall cause any of its subsidiaries
to, seek to negotiate a settlement with the PBGC to avoid an involuntary plan termination. In
connection with such negotiated settlement, Ford shall endeavor not to grant to the PBGC a security
interest in the assets of Ford Credit that has priority over the claims of unsecured creditors of
Ford Credit.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.&nbsp;All determinations to be made under this Agreement shall be made in accordance with, or
with reference to financial statements prepared in accordance with, United States generally
accepted accounting principles. For purposes of this Agreement, the term &#147;lease receivables&#148; shall
mean &#147;net investment in operating leases&#148; as stated on or reflected in Ford Credit&#146;s consolidated
financial statements.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.&nbsp;During the term of this Agreement, Ford Credit shall continue to make inventory and
capital financing generally available to dealers of vehicles manufactured or sold by Ford or its
Automotive Affiliates and shall continue to make retail and lease financing generally available to
such dealers&#146; customers to substantially the same extent that Ford Credit has historically made
such services available, so long as providing such services to such an extent would not result in a
breach of any of the foregoing provisions. Nothing herein precludes Ford Credit from providing or
continuing to provide financial services to automotive manufacturers other than Ford or its
Automotive Affiliates.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.&nbsp;In addition to any rights of set-off Ford and Ford Credit may have against the other as a
matter of law or otherwise, (a)&nbsp;upon Ford Credit having failed, or being reasonably expected by
Ford to fail, to make payments in the ordinary course of business on a Ford Credit Obligation
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->3<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">or upon the commencement of any bankruptcy, insolvency or similar proceeding of Ford Credit or any
Credit Affiliate, Ford will have the right (but will not be obliged) without prior notice to Ford
Credit or any other person to set-off any Ford Credit Obligations (whether matured or contingent,
regardless of the currency or terms of the obligation) against Ford Obligations (whether matured or
contingent, regardless of the currency or terms of the obligation) and (b)&nbsp;upon Ford having failed
to, or being reasonably expected by Ford Credit to fail to, make payments in the ordinary course of
business on a Ford Obligation or upon the commencement of any bankruptcy, insolvency or similar
proceeding of Ford or an Automotive Affiliate, Ford Credit will have the right (but will not be
obliged) without prior notice to Ford or any other person to set-off any Ford Obligations (whether
matured or contingent, regardless of the currency or terms of the obligation) against Ford Credit
Obligations (whether matured or contingent, regardless of the currency or terms of the obligation).
If the amount of either a Ford Obligation or a Ford Credit Obligation is unascertained, Ford or
Ford Credit (as the case may be) may in good faith estimate that obligation and set-off in respect
of the estimate, subject to Ford or Ford Credit (as the case may be) accounting to the other when
the amount of such obligation is ascertained. For the avoidance of doubt, it is understood that
nothing in this paragraph creates a security interest. For purposes of this Agreement, the Ford
Obligations shall consist of the following obligations (whether or not then due) of Ford or an
Automotive Affiliate to Ford Credit or a Credit Affiliate: (i)&nbsp;interest rate subvention; (ii)&nbsp;lease
residual subvention; (iii)&nbsp;intercompany payables; (iv)&nbsp;notes payable; (v)&nbsp;uncollateralized
guarantees; (vi)&nbsp;FMC Related Receivables; and (vii)&nbsp;any other obligation of, or guaranteed by, Ford
or an Automotive Affiliate owing to Ford Credit or a Credit Affiliate whether or not it would
appear as an asset on a consolidated balance sheet of Ford Credit. For purposes of this Agreement,
the Ford Credit Obligations shall consist of the following obligations (whether or not then due) of
Ford Credit or a Credit Affiliate to Ford or an Automotive Affiliate: (i)&nbsp;notes payable; (ii)
intercompany payables; (iii)&nbsp;retiree healthcare and life insurance payables; (iv)&nbsp;intercompany
payables for taxes; and (v)&nbsp;any other obligation of Ford Credit or a Credit Affiliate owing to Ford
or an Automotive Affiliate. The parties agree that interest rate and lease subvention obligations
of Ford and Automotive Affiliates may be prepaid at any time and from time to time, and if the
agreements for such obligations do not contain prepayment provisions, then the value of such
subvention obligations for purposes of any prepayment thereof shall be calculated as the present
value thereof obtained by applying the then-current discount rate that has been agreed to between
Ford and Ford Credit. For purposes of this Agreement, the FMC Related Receivables means the
following types of receivables purchased by or assigned to Ford Credit or Credit Affiliates from
Ford or Automotive Affiliates, or originated by Ford Credit or Credit Affiliates, each of which may
be guaranteed (in whole or in part) by Ford or an Automotive Affiliate: receivables related to the
sale of automotive parts and accessories by Ford or an Automotive Affiliate (US, Canada, Europe and
Asia Pacific), receivables related to the Ford Rent A Car (FRAC)&nbsp;program, receivables related to
the company car program (US, Europe and Asia), receivables related to the chassis converter program
(US)&nbsp;and receivables related to the used vehicle repurchase program (US, Canada and Europe);
provided, however, that FMC Related Receivables shall not include any of the foregoing receivables
that have been sold in an on- or off-balance sheet securitization or other structured financing
transaction.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->4<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.&nbsp;During the term of this Agreement, Ford shall, and hereby does, guarantee to Ford Credit
the Ford Obligations of Automotive Affiliates, and Ford Credit shall, and hereby does, guarantee to
Ford the Ford Credit Obligations of Credit Affiliates.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;12.&nbsp;This Agreement shall be construed and interpreted in accordance with, and governed by,
the internal laws of the State of New York, excluding any choice of law rules that may direct the
application of the laws of another jurisdiction.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;13.&nbsp;This Agreement shall terminate on the Termination Date, which shall initially be December
11, 2011. On December&nbsp;11, 2007, and on each December&nbsp;11 thereafter during the term of this
Agreement, the Termination Date shall be extended automatically for an additional one-year period
(ending on the December&nbsp;11 next following the then-current Termination Date) unless either party
shall have given the other party written notice during the period beginning on the July 1 and
ending on the November 1 immediately preceding such December&nbsp;11, specifying its election not to
extend the Termination Date beyond the then-current Termination Date and that the term of this
Agreement shall, therefore, expire on such then-current Termination Date. Notwithstanding the
foregoing, the provisions of paragraph 10 relating to set-off shall survive the termination of this
Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>IN WITNESS WHEREOF</B>, the parties hereto have caused this Agreement to be duly executed as of
the day and year first above written.
</DIV>
<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">

</TD>

    <TD align="left" valign="top">Vice Chairman, Chief Financial Officer</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.U.1
<SEQUENCE>10
<FILENAME>k12522exv10wuw1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>DESCRIPTION OF SETTLEMENT OF SPECIAL 2006-2008 SENIOR EXECUTIVE RETENTION
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10wuw1</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left">
<A name="166"></A>
</DIV>


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10-U-1</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>Description of Settlement of Special 2006-2008 Senior Executive Retention Program</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">As a result of a recent review of our incentive compensation programs, on February&nbsp;27, 2007, the
Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors decided to settle the Special 2006-2008 Senior
Executive Retention Program. The program was viewed as inconsistent with Ford&#146;s
strategic need to have our executives work together to achieve common goals as a team. The
consideration for settling the program is a cash payout to be made to participants based on actual
and expected achievement of the manufacturing capacity reduction goals for 2006-2008 and, for the
other goals shown below, actual 2006 achievement. (The Committee did not use expected 2007 and
2008 results for the other metrics shown below due to the lack of data or difficulty in estimating
future results.)
</DIV>

<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="88%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="7%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD nowrap align="left"><B>Metric</B></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="center"><B>% Performance Achieved</B></TD>
</TR>

<!-- End Table Head -->
<!-- Begin Table Body -->
<TR valign="bottom" style="background: #cceeff">
    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">1. Manufacturing capacity reduction</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">50%</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">2. Cost Reduction</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">33%</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="background: #cceeff">
    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">3. Market Share &#150; U.S.</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">0%</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">4. Market Share &#150; Asia</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">0%</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="background: #cceeff">
    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">5. Automotive Components Holdings, LLC</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">33%</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Participants
must repay the settlement amount if they leave the Company before
March&nbsp;2009 for any
reason except an approved retirement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In addition, the Committee decided to grant additional stock options in March&nbsp;2007 and
performance-based restricted stock units in March&nbsp;2007, March&nbsp;2008, and March&nbsp;2009 to certain
officer participants as an enhancement under the long-term incentive program. The Committee reduced
the award opportunity (set at eight times base salary rounded to the nearest million) for
individual officers under the 2007 program by the amount of their cash payout, if any, under the
2006-2008 Senior Executive Retention Program. The value of the net amount of the award
opportunity will be delivered 50% in stock options and 50% in performance-based restricted stock
units. Each grant of performance-based restricted stock units will use the same metrics and
weightings as the Annual Incentive Compensation Plan for the applicable performance period.
</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio --><!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>


</BODY>
</HTML>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.AA.1
<SEQUENCE>11
<FILENAME>k12522exv10waaw1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>ARRANGEMENT BETWEEN FORD MOTOR COMPANY & MARK FIELDS
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10waaw1</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left">
<A name="172"></A>
</DIV>

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10-AA-1</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>Arrangement between Ford Motor Company<BR>
and Mark Fields, dated February&nbsp;7, 2007</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">On February&nbsp;7, 2007, the Compensation Committee of the Company&#146;s Board of Directors approved a
request by Mark Fields, Executive Vice President and President, The Americas, regarding a change in
his compensation arrangement related to his use of Company aircraft. Mr.&nbsp;Fields will no longer use
Company aircraft for personal travel. The Company will pay the costs, including first class
commercial airfare, for personal travel to and from his home in Florida. The Company will continue
to provide tax relief as a result of the imputed income associated with this arrangement.
</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio --><!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>


</BODY>
</HTML>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.BB
<SEQUENCE>12
<FILENAME>k12522exv10wbb.htm
<DESCRIPTION>DESCRIPTION OF COMPANY PRACTICES
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10wbb</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left">
<A name="174"></A>
</DIV>

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10-BB</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>Description of Company Practices Regarding Club Memberships for Executives</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Certain Group Vice Presidents and a limited number of other employees may be reimbursed (or have
fees paid on their behalf) for expenses associated with certain club memberships when such
memberships are considered to be beneficial to the Company&#146;s interests. The expenses reimbursed
under this practice are restricted to initiation fees, membership fees, dues, assessments, and
other expenses required to maintain memberships in good standing. Greens fees and other charges
related to the use of the facilities are not reimbursed.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In addition, the Company maintains a number of corporate memberships for officers at the Tournament
Players Club (TPC)&nbsp;of Michigan. Effective January&nbsp;1, 2007, those officers with TPC corporate
memberships may retain their membership; however, all charges related to the TPC membership will
become their personal responsibility.
</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

</BODY>
</HTML>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Addition to Article&nbsp;1 of the Terms and Conditions</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Notwithstanding anything contained herein, in the Agreement or in the Features and Highlights of
Your Stock Options booklet to the contrary, the vesting requirements for your Option granted on
September&nbsp;1, 2006 covering 3,000,000 shares of Ford common stock will be removed in the event the
Company terminates your employment for reasons other than &#147;for cause&#148; during the first five years
of your employment or if there is a &#147;Change of Control&#148; of the Company during the first five years
of your employment accompanied by a termination of your employment for &#147;Good Reason&#148;, as more fully
described in the employment offer letter from Bill Ford to you dated August&nbsp;29, 2006 and accepted
by you on September&nbsp;1, 2006.&#148;
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U><B>Terms and Conditions of Stock Option Agreement (Nonqualified Option)</B></U><BR>
(Performance-Based Option Granted to Alan Mulally<BR>
on September&nbsp;1, 2006 Covering 1,000,000 Shares)
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Addition to Terms and Conditions</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Notwithstanding anything contained herein, in the Agreement or in the Features and Highlights of
Your Stock Options booklet to the contrary, your performance-based Option granted on September&nbsp;1,
2006 covering 1,000,000 shares of Ford common stock has a five year term and vesting will be based
solely on the closing price of Ford common stock on the New York Stock Exchange trading regular way
reaching certain thresholds that are maintained for at least 30 consecutive trading days, as more
fully described in the employment offer letter from Bill Ford to you dated August&nbsp;29, 2006 and
accepted by you on September&nbsp;1, 2006.&#148;
</DIV>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.CC.2
<SEQUENCE>14
<FILENAME>k12522exv10wccw2.htm
<DESCRIPTION>DESCRIPTION OF 2007 STOCK OPTION GRANT FOR ALAN MULALLY
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10wccw2</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left">
<A name="173"></A>
</DIV>

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10-CC-2</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>Description
of President and CEO Compensation Arrangements</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">After reviewing the Company&#146;s 2006 performance results and Mr.&nbsp;Mulally&#146;s leadership role in
progressing his key priorities, on February&nbsp;27, 2007, the Compensation Committee of the Board of
Directors decided to grant Alan Mulally, President and Chief Executive Officer, on March&nbsp;5, 2007
nonqualified stock options with a value of $6&nbsp;million. The options will have a ten-year term and
vest over a three-year period (33% after one year, 33% after two years and 34% after three years).
The $6&nbsp;million value represents the final March&nbsp;5, 2007 option grant value that previously was
described as having a $5&nbsp;million minimum value in the accession agreement between the Company and
Mr.&nbsp;Mulally dated as of September&nbsp;1, 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Additionally,
on February&nbsp;27, 2007, the Compensation Committee clarified the
terms of Mr. Mulally&#146;s employment arrangement concerning the use of
Company aircraft for personal reasons. As previously disclosed, Mr.
Mulally is required to use Company aircraft for personal travel for
security reasons and is entitled to have his wife, children, and
guests travel with him at Company expense. We have clarified that Mr.
Mulally&#146;s arrangement covers travel by his wife, children, and guests
on Company aircraft for personal reasons without him at Company
expense, at his request.</DIV>




<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio --><!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>


</BODY>
</HTML>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;CREDIT AGREEMENT (this &#147;<U>Agreement</U>&#148;), dated as of December&nbsp;15, 2006, among FORD MOTOR
COMPANY, a Delaware corporation (the &#147;<U>Company</U>&#148;), the Subsidiary Borrowers (as defined
herein) from time to time parties hereto, the several banks and other financial institutions or
entities from time to time parties hereto (the &#147;<U>Lenders</U>&#148;), CITIBANK, N.A. and GOLDMAN SACHS
CREDIT PARTNERS, L.P., as syndication agents (in such capacity, the &#147;<U>Syndication Agents</U>&#148;),
and JPMORGAN CHASE BANK, N.A., as administrative agent.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The parties hereto hereby agree as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">SECTION 1. DEFINITIONS

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.1 <U>Defined Terms</U>. As used in this Agreement, the terms listed in this Section&nbsp;1.1
shall have the respective meanings set forth in this Section&nbsp;1.1.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>ABR</U>&#148;: for any day, a rate per annum (rounded upwards, if necessary, to the next 1/16
of 1%) equal to the greater of (a) (i)&nbsp;the Prime Rate in effect on such day or (ii)&nbsp;in the case of
Canadian Revolving Loans denominated in Dollars made by a Qualifying Canadian Lender, the US Base
Rate (Canada) in effect on such day and (b)&nbsp;the Federal Funds Effective Rate in effect on such day
plus <FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>1</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">2</FONT> of 1%. Any change in the ABR due to a change in the Prime Rate, the US Base Rate (Canada)
or the Federal Funds Effective Rate shall be effective as of the opening of business on the
effective day of such change in the Prime Rate, the US Base Rate (Canada) or the Federal Funds
Effective Rate, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>ABR Loans</U>&#148;: Loans the rate of interest applicable to which is based upon the ABR.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Acceptance</U>&#148;: a Draft drawn by a Canadian Borrower on a Canadian Revolving Lender
conforming to the requirements of Section&nbsp;2.10 and accepted by such Canadian Revolving Lender in
accordance with Section&nbsp;2.10(c). As the context shall require, &#147;Acceptance&#148; shall also have the
meaning ascribed to it in Section&nbsp;2.10(j).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Acceptance Equivalent Loan</U>&#148;: an advance made under this Agreement by a Canadian
Revolving Lender evidenced by a Discount Note.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Acceptance Exposure</U>&#148;: at any time, the Dollar Equivalent of the aggregate face
amount of the outstanding Acceptances and Acceptance Equivalent Loans at such time. The Acceptance
Exposure of any Canadian Revolving Lender at any time shall be its Canadian Revolving Percentage of
the aggregate Acceptance Exposure at such time.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Acceptance Fee</U>&#148;: has the meaning assigned to such term in Section&nbsp;2.10(m).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Acceptance Obligation</U>&#148;: in respect of each Acceptance, the obligation of the
relevant Canadian Borrower to pay to the Canadian Revolving Lender that accepted such Acceptance
the face amount thereof as required by Section&nbsp;2.10(e).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Addendum</U>&#148;: (a)&nbsp;in the case of Revolving Lenders, a Master Addendum, Credit
Reallocation Agreement and Amendment Agreement, substantially in the form of Exhibit&nbsp;S-1 and (b)&nbsp;in
the case of Term Lenders, an Addendum Agreement, substantially in the form of Exhibit&nbsp;S-2.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Additional Subsidiary Guarantor</U>&#148;: each Domestic Subsidiary of the Company (other
than any Excluded Subsidiary) (a)&nbsp;that has Consolidated Total Assets with a Net Book Value in
excess of
$500,000,000 and (b)&nbsp;with respect to which the Company or any Subsidiary Guarantor directly or
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">indirectly owns 80% or more of the Capital Stock or Voting Stock of such Subsidiary and the
remaining Capital Stock of which is not publicly held.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Administrative Agent</U>&#148;: JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A., as the administrative agent for
the Lenders under this Agreement and the other Loan Documents (and, with respect to the Canadian
Revolving Facility, JPMorgan Chase Bank N.A., Toronto Branch), together with any of its successors.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Affected Foreign Currency</U>&#148;: as defined in Section&nbsp;2.23.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Agents</U>&#148;: the collective reference to the Collateral Trustee and the Administrative
Agent.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Aggregate Exposure</U>&#148;: with respect to any Lender at any time, an amount equal to (a)
until the Closing Date, the aggregate amount of such Lender&#146;s Commitments at such time and (b)
thereafter, the sum of (i)&nbsp;the aggregate then unpaid principal amount of such Lender&#146;s Term Loans
and (ii)&nbsp;the amount of such Lender&#146;s Revolving Commitments then in effect or, if the Revolving
Commitments have been terminated, the amount of such Lender&#146;s Revolving Extensions of Credit then
outstanding.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Aggregate Exposure Percentage</U>&#148;: with respect to any Lender at any time, the ratio
(expressed as a percentage) of such Lender&#146;s Aggregate Exposure at such time to the Aggregate
Exposure of all Lenders at such time.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Agreement</U>&#148;: as defined in the preamble hereto.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Applicable Lending Office</U>&#148;: for any Lender, with respect to the Company and each
Subsidiary Borrower, such Lender&#146;s office, branch or affiliate designated for Acceptances,
Acceptance Equivalent Loans, Eurocurrency Loans, ABR Loans, Canadian Base Rate Loans, L/C
Participations, Competitive Loans, Swingline Loans or Letters of Credit, as applicable, as notified
to the Administrative Agent and the Company or as otherwise specified in the Assignment and
Assumption pursuant to which such Lender became a party hereto, any of which offices may, subject
to Section&nbsp;2.26, be changed by such Lender upon 10&nbsp;days&#146; prior written notice to the Administrative
Agent and the Company.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Applicable Margin</U>&#148;: (a)&nbsp;with respect to Term Loans, (i)&nbsp;at any time when the
Company&#146;s Corporate Family Rating from Moody&#146;s is B2 or better and its Corporate Credit Rating from
S&#038;P is B or better, (A)&nbsp;1.75% per annum in the case of ABR Loans and (B)&nbsp;2.75% per annum in the
case of Eurocurrency Loans and (ii)&nbsp;at all other times, (A)&nbsp;2.00% per annum in the case of ABR
Loans and (B)&nbsp;3.00% per annum in the case of Eurocurrency Loans and (b)&nbsp;with respect to Revolving
Loans, (i)&nbsp;until delivery of financial statements for the first full fiscal quarter of the Company
completed after the Closing Date pursuant to Section&nbsp;6.1, (A)&nbsp;1.25% per annum in the case of ABR
Loans and Canadian Base Rate Loans and (B)&nbsp;2.25% per annum in the case of Eurocurrency Loans and
(ii)&nbsp;thereafter, the rate per annum set forth under the relevant column heading in the Pricing
Grid; <U>provided</U> that the Applicable Margin in effect at any time may be increased pursuant
to Section&nbsp;6.7(e).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Changes in the Applicable Margin for Term Loans resulting from changes in ratings by S&#038;P or
Moody&#146;s shall become effective on the Business Day following the announcement of such new rating.
If one or more of such rating agencies shall not have in effect a Corporate Family Rating or a
Corporate Credit Rating, as applicable (other than by reason of the circumstances referred to in
the following sentence), then the rating assigned by the other rating agency shall be used to
establish the Applicable Margin for the Term Loans. If the rating system of Moody&#146;s or S&#038;P shall
change, or if either
rating agency shall cease to be in the business of providing corporate ratings, the Company
and the
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->2<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Administrative Agent shall negotiate in good faith to amend this definition to reflect such
changed rating system or the unavailability of ratings from such rating agency and, pending the
effectiveness of any such amendment, the rating of such rating agency shall be determined by
reference to the rating most recently in effect prior to such change or cessation.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Applicable Premium</U>&#148;: as of any date of determination, the present value at such
date, computed using a discount rate equal to the Treasury Rate <U>plus</U> 50 basis points, of
(a)&nbsp;the prepayment premium applicable to the Term Loans of the applicable Term Lenders on the first
day after the second anniversary of the Closing Date, <U>plus</U> (b)&nbsp;all interest that would
accrue on such Term Loans from such date to the first day after the second anniversary of the
Closing Date, computed using the Eurocurrency Rate for an Interest Period of three months
<U>plus</U> the Applicable Margin for the Term Loans on such date.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Application</U>&#148;: an application, in such form as an Issuing Lender may specify from
time to time, requesting such Issuing Lender to open a Letter of Credit.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Approved Fund</U>&#148;: as defined in Section&nbsp;10.6(b).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Assignee</U>&#148;: as defined in Section&nbsp;10.6(b).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Assignment and Assumption</U>&#148;: an Assignment and Assumption, substantially in the form
of Exhibit&nbsp;O.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Attributable Debt</U>&#148;: as to any particular lease under which any Person is at the time
liable, at any date as of which the amount thereof is to be determined, the total net amount of
rent (discounted from the respective due dates thereof at the rate of 9.5% per annum) required to
be paid by such person under such lease during the remaining term thereof. The net amount of rent
required to be paid under any such lease for any such period shall be the total amount of the rent
payable by the lessee with respect to such period, but may exclude amounts required to be paid on
account of maintenance and repairs, insurance, taxes, assessments, water rates and similar charges.
In the case of any lease which is terminable by the lessee upon the payment of a penalty, such net
amount shall also include the amount of such penalty, but no rent shall be considered as required
to be paid under such lease subsequent to the first date upon which it may be so terminated.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Available Canadian Revolving Commitment</U>&#148;: as to any Canadian Revolving Lender at any
time, an amount equal to (a)&nbsp;such Lender&#146;s Canadian Revolving Commitment then in effect
<U>minus</U> (b)&nbsp;such Lender&#146;s Canadian Revolving Extensions of Credit then outstanding.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Available Domestic Revolving Commitment</U>&#148;: as to any Domestic Revolving Lender at any
time, an amount equal to (a)&nbsp;such Lender&#146;s Domestic Revolving Commitment then in effect
<U>minus</U> (b)&nbsp;such Lender&#146;s Domestic Revolving Extensions of Credit then outstanding.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Available Liquidity</U>&#148;: as of any date of determination, the sum of (a)&nbsp;the lesser of
(i)&nbsp;the Total Available Revolving Commitment (including any unused commitment under any Incremental
Revolving Facility or any Permitted Additional Senior Facility) and (ii)&nbsp;the excess of (A)&nbsp;the
Borrowing Base as of such date, <U>over</U> (B)&nbsp;the Borrowing Base Debt at such date <U>plus</U>
(b) &#147;automotive gross cash&#148; reported in the Company&#146;s most recent Annual Report on Form 10-K or
Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q, as applicable, filed with the SEC (excluding such amounts held or
owned by Foreign Subsidiaries).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Available Multicurrency Revolving Commitment</U>&#148;: as to any Multicurrency Revolving
Lender at any time, an amount equal to (a)&nbsp;such Lender&#146;s Multicurrency Revolving Commitment then in
effect <U>minus </U>(b)&nbsp;such Lender&#146;s Multicurrency Revolving Extensions of Credit then
outstanding.
</DIV>
